The Criterion collection ; 679 Title from container. Each part consists of 2 DVDs and 1 Blu-ray disc containing 3 films. Originally released as 25 individual motion pictures from 1962 to 1973. Based on the novel by Shimozawa Kan. Special features: New digital restoration of all twenty-five films, with uncompressed monaural soundtrack on the Blu-rays. Disc 25: The blind swordsman (a 1978 documentary about Zatoichi portrayer and filmmaker Shintaro Katsu). Disc 26: Serialized success (interview with Asian-film critic Tony Rayns on the Zatoichi series); Trailers (theatrical trailers for all 15 Zatoichi movies); New English subtitle translation. Booklet featuring essays, synopses, the original short story by Kan Shimozawa and twenty-five new illustrations. part 1. discs 1-3. The colossally popular Zatoichi films make up the longest-running action series in Japanese history and created one of the screen's great heroes: an itinerant blind masseur who also happens to be a lightning-fast swordsman. Features the string of twenty-five Zatoichi films made between 1962 and 1973, starring Shintaro Katsu, collected in one package for the first time. Rating: Not rated. DVD; NTSC; region 1; 2.35:1 aspect ratio; monaural. Blu-ray; enhanced for widescreen (16:9) presentation; requires Blu-ray player. No public performance rights. general_note_ssm: Each part consists of 2 DVDs and 1 Blu-ray disc containing 3 films.
Originally released as 25 individual motion pictures from 1962 to 1973.
Based on the novel by Shimozawa Kan.

Special features: New digital restoration of all twenty-five films, with uncompressed monaural soundtrack on the Blu-rays. Disc 25: The blind swordsman (a 1978 documentary about Zatoichi portrayer and filmmaker Shintaro Katsu). Disc 26: Serialized success (interview with Asian-film critic Tony Rayns on the Zatoichi series); Trailers (theatrical trailers for all 15 Zatoichi movies); New English subtitle translation. Booklet featuring essays, synopses, the original short story by Kan Shimozawa and twenty-five new illustrations.

notes_summary_ssim: The colossally popular Zatoichi films make up the longest-running action series in Japanese history and created one of the screen's great heroes: an itinerant blind masseur who also happens to be a lightning-fast swordsman. Features the string of twenty-five Zatoichi films made between 1962 and 1973, starring Shintaro Katsu, collected in one package for the first time.
technical_details_ssm: DVD; NTSC; region 1; 2.35:1 aspect ratio; monaural.
Blu-ray; enhanced for widescreen (16:9) presentation; requires Blu-ray player.
terms_use_reproduction_ssm: No public performance rights.  Classroom instruction and home use permitted.
